name: The Gardens Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Gardens Hotel during out 3rd Anniversary. Everything about this place was BEYOND Fantastic. Everyone there was helpful and extremely nice which made our stay very welcoming. We were very lucky to be able to extend our stay 1 extra day which we hated to leave. The rooms were EXCELLENT, clean and comfortable. We enjoyed every morning on the porch having breakfast. The food was just as good as our stay! We will definately be returning and recommending The Gardens Hotel to anyone who is looking to stay at Key West. - "The Happy Couple"
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just spent our 5th wedding aniversary in Key West. We have been to Key West many times but this was our first stay at the Gardens Hotel.I cant say enough good about the place very friendly helpful staff, Billy the bartender was great,Carlos was helpful with any special needs we had.The room was very clean and very spacious,wonderful gardens and pool.We will definetly stay at the Gardens again soon. John and Patty , Winslow Maine September 9th 2007.
reviews.title: we loved the gardens hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for just one night, but what a stay. We'd asked for two rooms together and were given ones with a shared balcony overlooking the street. Nice and quiet but you could still see the world go by. The rooms were perfect with everything you could need. We were recommended the Hot Tin Roof restaurant to eat in and the hotel booked this for us. Excellent recommendation as this was perfect to watch the sunset. The gardens themselves were excellent with too much to see for our short stay. Will definately return in the very near future.
reviews.title: Great stay at The Gardens
The Gardens were truly magical!
reviews.text: The hotel was absolutely fabulous. I have only good things to say about the room, pool with poolside bar and the garden with all of its animals! Some of the office staff was snooty, they need to remember they are in the HOSPITALITY business. The outside staff like Alicia and all her friends were the best though! We will definately go back, and only stay at this hotel. Top Notch and Comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small luxury hotel is perfectly positioned in the heart of Old Town Key West. The Garden room that we stayed in, the tranquil gardens and relaxing pool area and bar provide privacy and a haven from the bustle of Duval Street. The service is exceptional - friendly,efficient, polite and the front desk staff are very knowledgeable regarding the best places to dine and when to visit the attractions. A delicious buffet breakfast is provided daily to set you up for the day and the afternoon bar staff are a colourful and entertaining bunch (as well as producing a mean cocktail).
reviews.title: A haven
Loved the The Gardens Hotel
reviews.text: We recently stayed 6 nights at The Gardens Hotel while attending a wedding. Everything about our stay was excellent. The Gardens Hotel is beautifully decorated and comfortable with lush gardens, delicious breakfast specials each morning and a friendly & helpful staff which all made for a memorable stay. I look forward to returning to this little piece of paradise. Thanks to everyone!

likes.liked: — Gardens, food, friendly staff and beautifully decorated
likes.disliked: — wireless internet was hit or miss at times but not a problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my partner to the Gardens as part of our holiday to Florida. I can only second what others have written about this lovely haven of peace and tranquility. We stayed in the Eyebrow Cottage and were truly impressed by the decor which was both opulent yet homely. The staff were truly exceptional and bent over backwards to help me in setting up an area in the beautiful gardens so I could propose to my partner. The effort made by them made the event so special. If you are going to Key West whether for wild fun or a secret proposal I heartily recommend the Gardens.
reviews.title: Simply Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here during Fantasy Fest 2008 for 5 nights. What a delight this place was! From the friendly champagne welcome, to the beautiful garden room (not to mention the garden), to the wonderfully different breakfasts, help with reservations and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Simply Wonderful

likes.liked: — The overall atmosphere in this typical Key West Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in many "boutique hotels" and this is one of the best. The location is excellent. You are a block away from busy Duval street but once you enter the premises you only hear birdsong.
reviews.title: Very Romantic Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Treat yourself and stay at The Gardens Hotel in Key West. We will be back.
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay in Key West

likes.liked: — The Gardens offers a secluded, private, and romatic location in the heart of Key West's hot spots.
likes.disliked: — There is very limited parking at the Gardens but this is the same everywhere on the island. I would suggest leaving the car at home and renting a scooteror an electric car while there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set in beautiful gardens just a block off of Duval Street. We were greeted by friendly hotel staff who gave us champagne and had our bags taken to our room as we completed the check-in process.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in Key West

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable and well appointed room in a great location with a great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was beautifully appointed with a comfortable bed. Well thought out amenities included a flat screen tv, free wireless internet, refrigerator, insulated sports bottles (use while visiting and take home), hairdryer, sunscreen, lotion, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, makeup remover wipes, loofahs, cotton balls and swabs and probably more that I can't think of. You almost only need to bring clothes!
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else

likes.liked: — Time at the pool bar with Billy and Alicia
likes.disliked: — I seriously can't think of anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There is a small swimming pool and jacuzzi in the center of the property with a bar. An ice machine and a water dispenser by the pool bar were available to guests. Breakfast is included with your stay and was served on the patio each morning. The food was good and serving staff friendly.
reviews.title: The Gardens..... Unequaled!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a quiet location, even with it's proximity to the action of Duvall St. It is within walking distance to most anything you would want to do, but there are moped and electric car rentals nearby if you want wheels.
reviews.title: If you want the best..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the other fabulous reviews are just right on....heavenly beds, all toiletries provided, clean and well-decorated, comfortable rooms, relaxing atmosphere, cool pool, hot spa, comfy pool bar, excellent check-in and support from the ladies at the front desk, etc. etc. but what really makes this place are the two folks who hold incredibly special places in my heart (and the hearts of many other people if you read back in the reviews): Billy and Alicia you guys ROCK!!! YOU are the reason I would never stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: IMPRESSIVE SMALL HOTEL

likes.disliked: — the tipping envelope that is left by room cleaning staff/not classy for this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have known of this B&B since Kate, the owner, sold Ambrosia Key West to buy The Gardens. I have been a regular guest of Ambrosia for the past 10 years. My boyfriend was returning from overseas 16 September, and I wanted a little get away for us at a nice place. As Ambrosia was full, I decided to try their "sister" B&B, The Gardens.
reviews.title: Wonderful 2 Day Escape
A little oasis in the middle of Key West Fl
reviews.text: I telephoned the property directly and Carlos offered a choice of several rooms. I chose a garden view room because I thought it would be quiet. I was asked approx arrival time, knowing check-in is normally in the afternoon and said, "we will probably be down around noon, but we are fine to have lunch before we check-in."

reviews.title: The Best Birthday Gift I have ever given my wife
reviews.text: We arrived as planned at noon. Nancy on the desk was extremely welcoming and said "we have your room ready." She then asked if I was familiar with the property, and I wasn't, so she gave me a quick tour. The gardens are absolutely wonderful! To make a long story short, everything was perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a nice size with a marble bathroom. There was a small flat screen tv, ample seating area and a wonderful king size bed with feather top mattress and 8 pillows. I was in heaven! We had chairs in front of the room on the veranda and could enjoy the lush tropical landscape.
reviews.title: A little piece of paradise
Gardens Hotel, Key West, Florida
reviews.text: The pool is nice size for Key West and a basket of towels is by it. There is also fresh drinking water and ice. In late afternoon a pool side full bar is open for guests and the bartender was great! Even got to catch-up with Kate on the afternoon of our last day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the gardens in the Eyebrow cottage for 3 nights in early January. I have to say I found the check in procedure great with the glass of champagne!. we were shown to our cottage via the gardens which are as most describe lush and tropical .The pool and bar are fantastic and nothing is to much trouble.
reviews.title: The Gardens much as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our cottage was of a high standard and we had our own parking space, I think the only draw back with having rented the cottage rather than a room is that we had our own enterance, therefore we did get to see many of the staff and guests.
reviews.title: Paradise in Key West..........the Gardens Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is about th note breakfast, concidering the rather over the top charge for this hotel, I think the breakfast could have been more up marked, more chioce would have been good, with more cooked food.
reviews.title: Quality mind time

likes.liked: — The Worlds Best Beds, Breakfast, resident guard dogs, birds, and of course, the staff.
likes.disliked: — A butterfly landed on my arm?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that really enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent place for a romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However I dont know why they call it a cottage as it is a average size hotel room with no upstairs. It is luxury accomodation but dont book this thinking your getting a cottage !
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were due to spend two nights in Key West (our first trip) and liked the Gardens Hotel so much - we ended up staying for 6! The rooms are very comfortable, a good size and very clean.
reviews.title: Tranquillity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At around a block from Key West's lively Duval Street, it's hard to imagine that such a peaceful place exists so close to the 'life' of Key West.
reviews.title: a magic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gardens offers a relaxed, comfortable, easy-going environment where all of the staff are helpful, friendly and approachable. Our special thanks goes to Carlos, for his ever helpful and comprehensive advice on what to do and see in Key West, and to Alicia, for some unforgettable 'National Geographic' moments in the gardens!
reviews.title: what a joy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just can't wait to get back!
reviews.title: Garden of Eden
What a Splendid Retreat
reviews.text: the place is just glorious,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married in the gardens of the The Gardens Hotel. It was a beautiful, small and intimate ceremony. The hotel was fantastic and very helpful. We could not have asked for a better week of relaxation or a better place to get married.
reviews.title: Great place to get married!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited The Gardens Hotel this past Xmas and cannot say enough nice things about the property, the staff and the whole experience. The gardens are lush and tropical, which is where you have a delicious, included breakfast served each morning by attentive staff. The lovely staff at the front desk and the bar were more than helpful and friendly - they were all a true delight. They even arranged for bicycles to be delivered to the hotel on the day of our arrival which we used for the entire week.
reviews.title: A Tropical Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We highly recommend this hotel and Key West for an all-round terrific vacation. Our best ever!
reviews.title: Simply The Best!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I arrived on Dec 28th to a cold glass of champagne and the famous jazz on Sundays..what a way to kick off your vacation!! The staff(Lee,Cindy,Nancy)could not have been more accommodating,,whatever you need it's there! The Garden Room was fabulous,grounds perfect and breakfast outside on the patio was fabulous every morning(especially thanks to Tony!)
reviews.title: gorgeous place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone deserves to stay at The Gardens once in their life!!!!!
reviews.title: An oasis of charm and tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Gardens Hotel after reading rave reviews on Tripadvisor.com. May I just say that everything is absolutely true and the pictures do the property no justice.
reviews.title: We found paradise at the Gardens Hotel!

likes.liked: — Excellent staff, attracted the perfect type of fellow guests, and great pool scene.
likes.disliked: — That I couldn't stay for another week. This place is fabulous- nothing bad to say!

reviews.title: quaint secret gardens
reviews.text: The moment we arrived I felt at ease and was amazed at how beautiful this hidden paradise was. We were greeted by Carlos who provided us with Mimosas as we checked in and received a tour of the grounds. It is so rare to find people who actually care in the service industry and I was massively impressed by the commitment of everyone that we met there. A special thank you to Carlos (who knows EVERYTHING to do in town!), Billy (the best darn bartender and boat captain), Alicia (who has the best turtle stories!), and of course to Kate- we see why you are so proud of everyone and everything there. Your excellent attention to detail shows.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am adding pictures for you to see. We stayed in a courtyard room which could not have been more plush and I hope you take the time to see all of the animals on the property. The turtles and birds are beautiful. We had a perfect stay and made many new friends with the other guests. It was the perfect place for our engagement! Oh and of course, a delicious breakfast every morning, a cool pool for every hot afternoon, and close enough to Duval for the night!! (So close- but you'd never know by how quiet it is!)
reviews.title: One of the best

likes.liked: — Everything; the room, the pool, the gardens and Carlos
likes.disliked: — probably breakfast...it was good but the similiar each day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: You will NOT regret your stay at the Gardens. We stayed 6 nights and I wish it could have been more. We will certainly be back! Contact me if you have any questions!
reviews.title: Charming Key West Retreat

likes.liked: — quiet yet half a block from Duval

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gardens~ a lovely place to stay. A quaint place to stay away from the hustle and bustle of Duval street and its many tourists. We stayed in the garden rooms where it was a lovely retreat. It was peaceful and elegant. The staff were so kind and very helpful. They gave you the history of key west and the very best reccomendations to dine, drink, and explore. Carols was very helpful and reccommended only the best places to go. The grounds were beautifully maintained and the staff made you feel like you were home. The rooms were very well kept. Marble bathrooms, Aveda products, hotel collection towels, cozy beds with fabulous pillows, and old world charm. This place definately felt like home away from home. Breakfast was available daily with a variety of fruits, muffins, juices and coffee. I found this lovely retreat in the book 1,000 places to see before you die. If you travel to Key West it is the place to stay. High class without the pretentious attitudes. For fine dining we reccomend the A&B Marina, Michaels, Loui's Backyard (If you ignore the reviews the backyard is something to see and we are Jimmy B fans and had to be there!!)~ to drink we enjoyed Turttle Kraals (loved Chucky) conch republic, sloppy joe's, Hog's Breath Saloon, green parrot was okay if you want to be with the locals and we thought we did but their not too friendly. Hemingway House was great but definatley stick around to get the tour because, if you don't, you won't know what the hell your looking at and its definately interesting. Sunset tour is great and we used Fury for our excursions. We definatley enjoyed their 2 man band Cory Heydon was great to listen to and watching the sunset. I am a little disappointend that Key West doesnt equally revere Jimmy Buffett as much as they say they do. I'm sure they're tired of the Jimmy Buffett questions but, being from Philly I thought that they would show a little more respect to someone who put them on the map( obviously Heminway did but that's a really long time ago) I am a big JB fan. I thought they would at least be kind to him. That was a disappointmen! Carlos gave us great advice and steared us to where we wanted to be. Mr. Z's (from Philly) the best pizza and cheese steaks. Great fries too! He was so kind and very helpful also. Also if your going to go jet skiing check out the Wilkes Barre boys down on the Marina. Can't think of the name but their located right next to the tikki bar on the end.
reviews.title: Lovely!!!

description: Once the largest private estate in Key West, the expansive grounds of The Gardens Hotel house 17 luxurious guest suites, and comprise over an acre of lush, tropical landscaping just steps away from Key West's infamous Duval Street. The Gardens Hotel calls to mind the best of elegant boutique hotels,but with a decidedly Key West atmosphere. Start your day with a tropical complimentary breakfast and relax in our pool open 24 hours. Our d'Vine Wine Gallery is the first Enomatic wine tasting system in the Keys. Taste, Flight or full pour, you can enjoy up to 35 different wines from around the world. Every Sunday 'Jazz In The Gardens' starts at 5 and ends around 7:30pm. Now a tradition and a stop off for both locals and guests, world class entertainers all in the beautiful Gardens.
